name: DNS
overview:
This class allows you interact with Google Cloud DNS.

First, install @google-cloud/dns with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/dns

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/dnsâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Compute Engine

var dns = require('@google-cloud/dns')();

Elsewhere

var dns = require('@google-cloud/dns')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/dns are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: DNS
methods.description: Google Cloud DNS is a high- performance, resilient, global DNS service that provides a cost-effective way to make your applications and services available to your users. This programmable, authoritative DNS service can be used to easily publish and manage DNS records using the same infrastructure relied upon by Google.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

exceptions.description: If a zone name is not provided.
If a zone dnsName is not provided.

methods.name: getZones
methods.description: Gets a list of managed zones for the project.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: query.maxApiCalls
params.description: • Maximum number of API calls to make.

methods.name: getZonesStream
methods.description: Gets a list of dns/zone objects for the project as a readable object stream.

examples.caption: If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: query
params.description: • Configuration object. See dns#getZones for a complete list of options.

methods.name: zone
methods.description: Create a zone object representing a managed zone.
